issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://character.ai.](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fcharacter.ai.) ### Comment > After using the adguard app for several months with same setting with no issues with it not working for the character ai app I'm suddenly seeing ads in the app. I have checked for updates but everything seems completely up to date. I'm wondering if this may have to do with some sort of update to the character ai app itself ``` Username: @vesper4seance ``` ### Screenshots

issue.title: mubi.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://mubi.com/en/nl/films/gachiakuta](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmubi.com%2Fen%2Fnl%2Ffilms%2Fgachiakuta) ### Comment > share button ``` Username: @rakleed ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/knm6xf41e680ksogws80oo0sso0c4oo6juiihajqe0.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Mac v2.17.2.1984 release System version: | `MacOS 15.5 (Build 24F74)` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Hide your search queries

**Tracking methods**:
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180),
Disable cache for third-party requests

**Miscellaneous**:
Hide your Referrer from third-parties,
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
Protect against DPI DNS filtering: | server: `https://xxxxxxx@d.adguard-dns.com/dns-query`
Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads
